title: They Can’t Quit Him
sub_head: The first full week of the post-Trump era wasn’t kind to CNN.
body:
No media outlets worked harder than CNN and MSNBC to promote Donald Trump’s quest for the Republican nomination for president in 2016. Their investment of massive airtime certainly paid off, as the Trump era turned out to be a golden age for political controversy and news-like programming.
Back in 2015, staff at the two networks were likely happy to enlist in the Trump promotion project because they figured he was the Republican most likely to lose to Hillary Clinton. Their candidate ended up losing in 2016 but they could take consolation in a clear commercial victory. The business of bashing Donald Trump, known as “resistance journalism” in the trade, has been both fun and profitable. Now what do they do?
In December this column asked whether the cable nets could hold their audiences by lauding Joe Biden. The early returns, based on the first full week of the Biden presidency, may be cause for concern.
Gavin Bridge reports on CNN for Variety:
The latest Trump impeachment drama starting next week with a Senate trial could be a sort of last hurrah for current programming strategies.
